thread.title: Toyota (TM) Completes 1 Million Vehicle Sales in Philippines - Analyst Blog
thread.title_full: Toyota (TM) Completes 1 Million Vehicle Sales in Philippines - Analyst Blog

title: Toyota (TM) Completes 1 Million Vehicle Sales in Philippines - Analyst Blog
text:
Content preferences Done 
Toyota Motor Corporation TM has become the first automaker to sell over 1 million vehicles in the Philippines. The automaker achieved this milestone in April this year, as Toyota Motor Philippines Corporation ("TMP”) sold 9,467 units in the country. TMP is a joint venture of GT Capital Holdings, Inc., Toyota Motor Corporation and Mitsui & Co. Ltd.According to the latest Chamber of Automotive Manufacturers of the Philippines, Inc. (“CAMPI”) report, Toyota has completed 1,000,468 vehicle sales in Philippines since 1989, when the automaker commenced operations in the country. Toyota is the largest vehicle brand in the Philippines. Moreover, it is one of the largest auto manufacturers in the region. In fact, over 60% of the 1,000,468 vehicles sold were produced at the former Bicutan Plant and the Santa Rosa Plant in Laguna, Philippines.Nearly 268,065 units of the popular Toyota Revo and Innova vehicles sold in the Philippines were made in the region. Moreover, around 213,325 units of the Corolla and 157,347 units of the Vios sold in the country were manufactured there.Toyota was expecting to reach the 1 million unit sales milestone later this year. However, better-than-expected sales led to this achievement significantly earlier.Toyota currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). Better-ranked automobile stocks include The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company GT, Fox Factory Holding Corp FOXF and U.S. Auto Parts Network, Inc. PRTS. Both Fox Factory Holding and U.S. Auto Parts currently sport a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), while Goodyear carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
